node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.text: Watch as @andybaraghani makes a sweet and refreshing margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled pineapple and mint, and lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita is quite possibly *the* drink of summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.text: #Ad Esther Choi (@choibites), chef/owner of @mokbar_nyc, is showing us how to make a mandu stir-fry with lots of vegetables and of course, @bibigoUSA’s mandu.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and standing.

node.text: “I try to separate myself from anyone or anything that makes me feel like there’s something wrong with the way that I’m eating food—and try to appreciate all the beings that gave themselves to make that food possible,” author and yoga teacher Jessamyn Stanley (@mynameisjessamyn) tells Associate Editor Ali Francis (@alifrancis.me). In Stanley’s new book “Yoke: My Yoga of Self-Acceptance,” she discusses her journey towards loving herself and her body. Francis spoke with Stanley about her struggles with body image, the hard truths she wants us to accept about ourselves, the food she’s cooking on repeat, and more. Read the full interview at the link in our bio. 📷: CORNELL WATSON

node.text: Chrissy Tracey (@eatwithchrissy) shows us how to make the perfectly complex @grandmarnierusa Grand Margarita with Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge, lime juice, reposado, and agave.

node.text: Salt: It’s what your cocktail has been missing. “Salt in drinks is underrated,” says Nahiel Nazzal (@nahiel), bar director and partner of San Francisco’s Pearl 6101 (@pearl_6101). “It adds balance, opens your palate, and makes you want to take another sip.” Stir a pinch into classics like Negronis as well as drinks with fruitier notes like this strawberry daiquiri, which incorporates an easy berry-infused simple syrup and just a pinch of salt. Click the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: @emmafishman🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: @seechaey and @susanhjkim set out to make delicious hand rolls, which it turns out are pretty hard to mess up. These rolls are a quick and delicious crowd-pleaser for summer dinner parties or snacks. Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 02, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: This refreshing summer side by cookbook author Leela Punyaratabandhu (@shesimmers) is a mash-up of two variations of the sour-salty-sweet Thai salad som tam. This streamlined version skips the traditional process of pounding the ingredients in a clay mortar and wooden pestle, and instead everything gets cut with a knife. Then you use your hands to mix and squeeze the components just until lightly wilted—the way this salad is supposed to be. Click the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: @dylanandjeni 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @tripleppp

node.text: We all love condiments. But @brad_leone @rawlstonwilliams @samanthaseneviratne @moroccochris @chefharoldvillarosa and @susanhjkim are going to show you how to make them even better. Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

user.full_name: S O F R E H

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by bonappetitmag on August 02, 2021 tagging @marcuscooks, @emma._bengtsson, @sophia_roe, @sonofasouthernchef, @fabianvhv, @jparkato, @thomasjraquel, @llama_erik, @sisitongtong, and @sofreh_brooklyn. May be an image of 11 people, people standing and text that says 'INTRODUCING 2021 MET GALA CHEFS'.

node.text: This year, the Met Gala is trying something new: an entirely plant-based menu. Ten chefs will be contributing recipes based on their own interpretations of regional American cuisines. They were chosen by Marcus Samuelsson (@marcuscooks), who wanted to represent and celebrate the next generation of American chefs—after all, the theme of this year’s Met Gala is ‘In America: A Lexicon of Fashion,’ the first of a two-part exhibit exploring modern American styles. For Samuelsson, bringing the plant-based discussion to the event felt natural. He tells Bon Appétit that he hopes that the food, just as much as the outfits, will spark a conversation. Click the link in our bio to read our exclusive interview with Samuelsson about why the Met Gala is going plant-based and which chefs will be cooking things up.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 01, 2021. May be an image of drink, fruit and indoor.

node.text: The best summer cocktails are as simple to make as they are refreshing. But just because our favorite hot weather drinks come together in no time doesn’t mean they dazzle any less. If sangria is your speed, we have a spritzy number that’s infused with ripe summer peaches. Looking to perfect your summer daiquiri? We got you. And if virgin thirst quenchers are what you’re after, we have plenty of nonalcoholic mocktail recipes too. Click the link in our bio for our ultimate list of easy summer cocktail recipes. Cheers!📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @curlygirlcooks 🥣: @elle_jaime | 📷: Heidi’s Bridge | 📷: @yungbludlau 🍴: @heysueli

node.text: Let this (very hot) summer be the season of icebox cakes. This yummy treat “is perfect for summer because you don’t have to turn on your oven,” says baker @samanthaseneviratne. In her recipe, store-bought ginger cookies soften into layers of tender cake surrounded by loads of raspberries and caramel cream. Once it's built, all you have to do is chill it, top it with more raspberries, and enjoy! Head to the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @tripleppp

node.text: Oyster sauce is something we always have in our fridge door. It’s packed with umami yet it is rarely overpowering, so it adds tons of depth to a stir-fry like this one. Serve this chicken and corn combination with rice and top it off with some fresh cilantro. No fresh corn at the market? Swap in peppers, peas, mushrooms, or summer squash. Click the link in our bio to make this all-around incredibly delicious dish. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @curlygirlcooks 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: On this episode of "It's Alive," @brad_leone takes a trip to Bozeman, Montana to experience some fly fishing with his buddy Steve Rinella. Check it out on YouTube at the link in our bio.

node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity
